alert.note: Alert for Atoka; Coal; Johnston; Pontotoc (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 16 at 4:16PM CDT until March 16 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Johnston County in southeastern Oklahoma... Coal County in southeastern Oklahoma... Southeastern Pontotoc County in east central Oklahoma... Central Atoka County in southeastern Oklahoma... * Until 500 PM CDT. * At 416 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Tupelo to 6 miles northwest of Clarita to near Connerville, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...The Fittstown Mesonet measured a 61 mph wind gust. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Atoka, Coalgate, Wapanucka, Stringtown, Lehigh, Tupelo, Tushka, Bromide, Centrahoma, Pontotoc, Clarita, Olney, Connerville, Wardville, Phillips, Atoka Reservoir, Jesse and Chockie. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
